TEXT.Spanish: Sir? Where are you Sir? Our leader has abandoned us in our time of need! We are undone!

TEXT.English: You become the leader of the least ranked civilization
TEXT.French: You become the leader of the least ranked civilization
TEXT.German: Ihr werdet der Anführer der Zivilisation mit dem geringsten Punktestand
TEXT.Italian: You become the leader of the least ranked civilization
TEXT.Spanish: You become the leader of the least ranked civilization

TEXT.English: Get me my sword, I will challenge their leader to single combat.
TEXT.French: Get me my sword, I will challenge their leader to single combat.
TEXT.German: Holt mir mein Schwert, ich werde ihren Führer zu einem Duell fordern.
TEXT.Italian: Get me my sword, I will challenge their leader to single combat.
TEXT.Spanish: Get me my sword, I will challenge their leader to single combat.

TEXT.English: The Barbarian troops leave
TEXT.French: The Barbarian troops leave
TEXT.German: Die Barbaren ziehen ab
TEXT.Italian: The Barbarian troops leave
TEXT.Spanish: The Barbarian troops leave

TEXT.English: Send emissaries to regale them with tales of our glorious empire, and offer them citizenship.
TEXT.French: Send emissaries to regale them with tales of our glorious empire, and offer them citizenship.
TEXT.German: Schickt Unterhändler und lasst diese Geschichten unseres glohrreichen Reiches erzählen. Bietet ihnen dann unsere Staatsangehörigkeit an.
TEXT.Italian: Send emissaries to regale them with tales of our glorious empire, and offer them citizenship.
TEXT.Spanish: Send emissaries to regale them with tales of our glorious empire, and offer them citizenship.

TEXT.English: City Gains 1 Population[NEWLINE]The Barbarian troops leave
TEXT.French: City Gains 1 Population[NEWLINE]The Barbarian troops leave
TEXT.German: Stadt erhült 1 Bevölkerungspunkt[NEWLINE]Die Barbaren verschwinden
TEXT.Italian: City Gains 1 Population[NEWLINE]The Barbarian troops leave
TEXT.Spanish: City Gains 1 Population[NEWLINE]The Barbarian troops leave

TEXT.English: Your units have spotted a unicorn outside of %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Vos troupes ont repéré une licorne à proximité de %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Eure Einheiten haben ein Einhorn vor den Toren von %s2_city gesichtet.
TEXT.Italian: Your units have spotted a unicorn outside of %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Your units have spotted a unicorn outside of %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Kill it, the horn alone is worth a fortune!
TEXT.French: Tuez-la, sa corne vaut une fortune à elle seule !
TEXT.German: Tötet es, allein sein Horn ist ein Vermögen wert!
TEXT.Italian: Kill it, the horn alone is worth a fortune!
TEXT.Spanish: Kill it, the horn alone is worth a fortune!

TEXT.English: Kill it, it's horn can purify water.
TEXT.French: Tuez-la. Sa corne servira à purifier l'eau de la ville.
TEXT.German: Tötet es, sein Horn kann Wasser reinigen.
TEXT.Italian: Kill it, it's horn can purify water.
TEXT.Spanish: Kill it, it's horn can purify water.

TEXT.English: Dinnertime, boys!
TEXT.French: Le dîner est servi, les gars !
TEXT.German: Essenzeit, Jungs!
TEXT.Italian: Dinnertime, boys!
TEXT.Spanish: Dinnertime, boys!

TEXT.English: Don't kill it! Oh wait...
TEXT.French: Don't kill it! Oh wait...
TEXT.German: Tötet es ja nicht! Nein wartet ...
TEXT.Italian: Don't kill it! Oh wait...
TEXT.Spanish: Don't kill it! Oh wait...

TEXT.English: Don't kill it!
TEXT.French: Don't kill it!
TEXT.German: Tötet es ja nicht!
TEXT.Italian: Don't kill it!
TEXT.Spanish: Don't kill it!

TEXT.English: A new judge has been very effective at keeping the streets safe in %s2_city, but we have found evidence that proves beyond a shadow of a doubt that he is corrupt.
TEXT.French: A new judge has been very effective at keeping the streets safe in %s2_city, but we have found evidence that proves beyond a shadow of a doubt that he is corrupt.
TEXT.German: Ein neuer Richter hat sich als sehr effektiv entpuppt, wenn es darum geht, die Straßen von %s2_city sicher zu machen, doch wir haben Beweise gefunden, die über jeden Zweifel erhaben sind, dass er korrupt ist.
TEXT.Italian: A new judge has been very effective at keeping the streets safe in %s2_city, but we have found evidence that proves beyond a shadow of a doubt that he is corrupt.
TEXT.Spanish: A new judge has been very effective at keeping the streets safe in %s2_city, but we have found evidence that proves beyond a shadow of a doubt that he is corrupt.

TEXT.English: As long as the populace sleeps safely at night, I do not care if he skims a little off the top.
TEXT.French: As long as the populace sleeps safely at night, I do not care if he skims a little off the top.
TEXT.German: Solang die Bevölkerung nachts sicher schlafen kann, interessiert mich nicht, ob er sich ein Stück vom Kuchen abschneidet.
TEXT.Italian: As long as the populace sleeps safely at night, I do not care if he skims a little off the top.
TEXT.Spanish: As long as the populace sleeps safely at night, I do not care if he skims a little off the top.

TEXT.English: Close the courthouse and see that it that he is brought to account for his crimes.
TEXT.French: Close the courthouse and see that it that he is brought to account for his crimes.
TEXT.German: Schließt das Gericht und sorgt dafür, dass er für seine Verbrechen büßt.
TEXT.Italian: Close the courthouse and see that it that he is brought to account for his crimes.
TEXT.Spanish: Close the courthouse and see that it that he is brought to account for his crimes.

TEXT.English: I will not stand for this. Make a full example of him and send a priest of Order to serve in his place.
TEXT.French: I will not stand for this. Make a full example of him and send a priest of Order to serve in his place.
TEXT.German: Ich will damit nichts zu tun haben. Statuiert an ihm ein Exempel und schickt einen Geweihten der Ordnung hin, der seinen Platz einnimmt.
TEXT.Italian: I will not stand for this. Make a full example of him and send a priest of Order to serve in his place.
TEXT.Spanish: I will not stand for this. Make a full example of him and send a priest of Order to serve in his place.

TEXT.English: He is obvious not being subtle enough. Show him how to hide his tracks... and see to it that we receive our cut.
TEXT.French: He is obvious not being subtle enough. Show him how to hide his tracks... and see to it that we receive our cut.
TEXT.German: Er geht offensichtlich nicht subtil genug vor. Zeigt ihm, wie er seine Spuren besser verwischen kann ... und kümmert Euch darum, dass Wir Unseren Anteil bekommen.
TEXT.Italian: He is obvious not being subtle enough. Show him how to hide his tracks... and see to it that we receive our cut.
TEXT.Spanish: He is obvious not being subtle enough. Show him how to hide his tracks... and see to it that we receive our cut.

TEXT.English: We have come across an isolated village of elves that managed to survive during the harsh Age of Ice. What do you want us to do with them?
TEXT.French: Nous sommes tombés sur un village elfique isolé ayant survécu tant bien que mal au dernier Âge de Glace. Que voulez-vous qu'on fasse d'eux ?
TEXT.German: Wir sind über ein isoliertes Elfendorf gestolpert, dass es geschafft hat, während des harten Zeitalters des Eises zu überleben. Was sollen wir mit den Elfen machen?
TEXT.Italian: We have come across an isolated village of elves that managed to survive during the harsh Age of Ice. What do you want us to do with them?
TEXT.Spanish: We have come across an isolated village of elves that managed to survive during the harsh Age of Ice. What do you want us to do with them?

TEXT.English: What do I care? Leave them to their fate.
TEXT.French: En quoi ça me concerne ? Abandonnez-les à leur triste sort.
TEXT.German: Was kümmert's mich? Überlasst sie ihrem Schicksal.
TEXT.Italian: What do I care? Leave them to their fate.
TEXT.Spanish: What do I care? Leave them to their fate.

TEXT.English: an Hamlet is created on the tile
TEXT.French: Un hameau elfe apparaît sur la case
TEXT.German: Ein Hamlet wird auf dem Feld erschaffen
TEXT.Italian: an Hamlet is created on the tile
TEXT.Spanish: an Hamlet is created on the tile

TEXT.English: Welcome them home!
TEXT.French: Qu'ils viennent vivre avec nous !
TEXT.German: Heißt sie zu Hause willkommen!
TEXT.Italian: Welcome them home!
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome them home!

TEXT.English: Requires Svartalfar or Ljosalfar
TEXT.French: Requiert les Svartalfar ou les Ljosalfar
TEXT.German: Erfordert Svartalfar oder Ljosalfar
TEXT.Italian: Requires Svartalfar or Ljosalfar
TEXT.Spanish: Requires Svartalfar or Ljosalfar

TEXT.English: Wipe them out to let our troops have some combat training.
TEXT.French: Exterminons-les ! Ça fournira à nos troupes une expérience du combat.
TEXT.German: Sie sollen unseren Truppen ein bisschen Kampftraining liefern. Radiert sie aus!
TEXT.Italian: Wipe them out to let our troops have some combat training.
TEXT.Spanish: Wipe them out to let our troops have some combat training.

TEXT.English: Wonderful! More petlings!
TEXT.French: Génial ! Des larbins gratuits !
TEXT.German: Wundervoll! Noch mehr Kriechtiere!
TEXT.Italian: Wonderful! More petlings!
TEXT.Spanish: Wonderful! More petlings!

TEXT.English: You receive 2 Elven Slaves. Requires Slavery or Dteshi Civilization
TEXT.French: Vous réduisez deux elfes en esclavage. Nécessite la doctrine Esclavage ou la civilisation Dteshi
TEXT.German: Ihr erhaltet 2 Elfische Sklaven. Erfordert Sklaverei oder Dteshi Zivilisation
TEXT.Italian: You receive 2 Elven Slaves. Requires Slavery or Dteshi Civilization
TEXT.Spanish: You receive 2 Elven Slaves. Requires Slavery or Dteshi Civilization

TEXT.English: Offer them refuge in our nearest town.
TEXT.French: Proposons-leur un refuge dans notre ville voisine.
TEXT.German: Bietet Ihnen Unterkunft in unserer nahegelegensten Stadt an.
TEXT.Italian: Offer them refuge in our nearest town.
TEXT.Spanish: Offer them refuge in our nearest town.

TEXT.English: Gains 1 Archery Range in the nearest City and an Elven Archer with Dexterous and Commando
TEXT.French: Obtenir 1 champ de tir dans la ville la plus proche, ainsi qu'un archer elfique avec les promotions adroit et commando
TEXT.German: Erhalte 1 Schießstand in der nächsten Stadt und einen Elfenbogenschützen mit 'Geschickt' und 'Kommando'
TEXT.Italian: Gains 1 Archery Range in the nearest City and an Elven Archer with Dexterous and Commando
TEXT.Spanish: Gains 1 Archery Range in the nearest City and an Elven Archer with Dexterous and Commando

TEXT.English: The market in %s2_city is drawing widespread attention as a place one can go to buy anything their heart desires.
TEXT.French: The market in %s2_city is drawing widespread attention as a place one can go to buy anything their heart desires.
TEXT.German: Der Markt in %s2_city zieht weitreichende Aufmerksamkeit auf sich als ein Ort, an dem man alles kaufen kann, was das Herz begehrt.
TEXT.Italian: The market in %s2_city is drawing widespread attention as a place one can go to buy anything their heart desires.
TEXT.Spanish: The market in %s2_city is drawing widespread attention as a place one can go to buy anything their heart desires.

TEXT.English: Make a personal visit to the market to give my endorsement.
TEXT.French: Make a personal visit to the market to give my endorsement.
TEXT.German: Ich werde persönlich diesen Markt besuchen, um meine Anerkennung zu zeigen.
TEXT.Italian: Make a personal visit to the market to give my endorsement.
TEXT.Spanish: Make a personal visit to the market to give my endorsement.

TEXT.English: Send out word with the traders! Our market will be known world-wide.
TEXT.French: Send out word with the traders! Our market will be known world-wide.
TEXT.German: Verbreitet die Kunde mit Händlern! Unser Markt wird weltweit bekannt sein.
TEXT.Italian: Send out word with the traders! Our market will be known world-wide.
TEXT.Spanish: Send out word with the traders! Our market will be known world-wide.

TEXT.English: Have our sages search the bazaar for interesting relics of the past.
TEXT.French: Have our sages search the bazaar for interesting relics of the past.
TEXT.German: Unsere Weisen sollen auf dem Markt nach interessanten Relikten vergangener Zeiten suchen.
TEXT.Italian: Have our sages search the bazaar for interesting relics of the past.
TEXT.Spanish: Have our sages search the bazaar for interesting relics of the past.

TEXT.English: Sire, our sages in %s2_city have created a strategic board game based on Erebus' history. They call it "Fall From Heaven".
TEXT.French: Sire, nos sages à %s2_city ont créé un jeu de plateau de stratégie basé sur l'histoire d'Erebus. Ils l'ont nommé "Fall From Heaven".
TEXT.German: Sire, unsere Weisen haben in %s2_city ein Strategiebrettspiel entwickelt, das auf der Geschichte von Erebus basiert. Sie nennen es 'Fall From Heaven'.
TEXT.Italian: Sire, our sages in %s2_city have created a strategic board game based on Erebus' history. They call it "Fall From Heaven".
TEXT.Spanish: Sire, our sages in %s2_city have created a strategic board game based on Erebus' history. They call it "Fall From Heaven".

TEXT.English: Bah, those sages have too much time on their hands.
TEXT.French: Peuh ! Ces sages ont vraiment du temps à perdre.
TEXT.German: Pah, diese Weisen haben eindeutig zuviel Zeit.
TEXT.Italian: Bah, those sages have too much time on their hands.
TEXT.Spanish: Bah, those sages have too much time on their hands.

TEXT.English: It could become a widespread pastime. Sponsor the game!
TEXT.French: Ça pourrait faire un bon passe-temps. Subventionnez le jeu !
TEXT.German: Es könnte ein weitverbreiteter Zeitvertreib werden. Sponsort das Spiel!
TEXT.Italian: It could become a widespread pastime. Sponsor the game!
TEXT.Spanish: It could become a widespread pastime. Sponsor the game!

TEXT.English: Have the sages come up with a fantasy variant. Call it "Civilization".
TEXT.French: Dites aux sages d'en réaliser une variante fantaisiste et appelez-la "Civilization".
TEXT.German: Die Weisen sollen eine Fantasy-Variante entwickeln. Nennt es 'Civilization'.
TEXT.Italian: Have the sages come up with a fantasy variant. Call it "Civilization".
TEXT.Spanish: Have the sages come up with a fantasy variant. Call it "Civilization".

TEXT.English: Wait, Fall from Heaven? Blasphemy!
TEXT.French: Quoi ? La chute du Paradis ? Hérétiques ! Au bûcher !
TEXT.German: Wartet, 'Fall from Heaven'? Blasphemie!
TEXT.Italian: Wait, Fall from Heaven? Blasphemy!
TEXT.Spanish: Wait, Fall from Heaven? Blasphemy!

TEXT.English: Receive 1 Acolyte with Inquisitor
TEXT.French: Recevoir un Inquisiteur
TEXT.German: Erhaltet 1 Akolyt der Weisung mit 'Inquisitor'
TEXT.Italian: Receive 1 Acolyte with Inquisitor
TEXT.Spanish: Receive 1 Acolyte with Inquisitor

TEXT.English: An experienced traveler has just arrived at your palace. For a little fee he can tell one story. What would you like to hear about?
TEXT.French: An experienced traveler has just arrived at your palace. For a little fee he can tell one story. What would you like to hear about?
TEXT.German: Ein erfahrener Reisender hat unseren Palast erreicht. Für ein kleines Handgeld kann er Euch eine Geschichte erzählen. Worüber würdet Ihr gern etwas erfahren?
TEXT.Italian: An experienced traveler has just arrived at your palace. For a little fee he can tell one story. What would you like to hear about?
TEXT.Spanish: An experienced traveler has just arrived at your palace. For a little fee he can tell one story. What would you like to hear about?

TEXT.English: Tell me about natural wonders of Erebus.
TEXT.French: Parlez-moi des merveilles naturelles d'Erebus.
TEXT.German: Erzählt mir etwas über die natürlichen Wunder von Erebus.
TEXT.Italian: Tell me about natural wonders of Erebus.
TEXT.Spanish: Tell me about natural wonders of Erebus.

TEXT.English: Tell me about remnants from ancient Ages.
TEXT.French: Parlez-moi des ruines des anciens Âges.
TEXT.German: Erzählt mir etwas über die Überreste aus früheren Zeitaltern.
TEXT.Italian: Tell me about remnants from ancient Ages.
TEXT.Spanish: Tell me about remnants from ancient Ages.

TEXT.English: Tell me about holy shrines of the gods.
TEXT.French: Parlez-moi des lieux saints des Dieux
TEXT.German: Erzählt mir etwas über heilige Schreine der Götter.
TEXT.Italian: Tell me about holy shrines of the gods.
TEXT.Spanish: Tell me about holy shrines of the gods.

TEXT.English: Tell me about places related to the angels.
TEXT.French: Parlez-moi des endroits liés aux anges.
TEXT.German: Erzählt mir etwas über Orte, die mit Engeln in Verbindung stehen.
TEXT.Italian: Tell me about places related to the angels.
TEXT.Spanish: Tell me about places related to the angels.

TEXT.English: Tell me about the biggest city he has ever seen.
TEXT.French: Parlez-moi de la plus grande ville que vous ayez découverte.
TEXT.German: Erzählt mir etwas über die größte Stadt, die Ihr je gesehn habt.
TEXT.Italian: Tell me about the biggest city he has ever seen.
TEXT.Spanish: Tell me about the biggest city he has ever seen.

TEXT.English: I have neither time nor money for this.
TEXT.French: Je n'ai ni le temps ni l'argent pour ces bêtises.
TEXT.German: Ich habe dafür weder Zeit noch Geld.
TEXT.Italian: I have neither time nor money for this.
TEXT.Spanish: I have neither time nor money for this.

TEXT.English: There's just been an assassination attempt on you! What do you want to do with the assassin?
TEXT.French: Vous venez juste d'échapper à une tentative d'assassinat ! Quel sort l'assassin mérite-t-il ?
TEXT.German: Man hat versucht, Euch ermorden zu lassen! Der Versuch ist gescheitert. Was wollt Ihr mit der gefangenen Meuchlmörderin tun?
TEXT.Italian: There's just been an assassination attempt on you! What do you want to do with the assassin?
TEXT.Spanish: There's just been an assassination attempt on you! What do you want to do with the assassin?

TEXT.English: Don't we have a feast scheduled for tomorrow?
TEXT.French: On avait pas un festin prévu pour demain ?
TEXT.German: Haben wir nicht ein Fest angesetzt für morgen?
TEXT.Italian: Don't we have a feast scheduled for tomorrow?
TEXT.Spanish: Don't we have a feast scheduled for tomorrow?

TEXT.English: Stop asking stupid questions and execute her!
TEXT.French: Arrêtez de poser des questions stupides et faites-le exécuter !
TEXT.German: Stellt nicht so dämliche Fragen und exekutiert sie!
TEXT.Italian: Stop asking stupid questions and execute her!
TEXT.Spanish: Stop asking stupid questions and execute her!

TEXT.English: Find out who sent her and make her spy on them for us.
TEXT.French: Trouvez son commanditaire et faites de l'assassin un agent double à notre service.
TEXT.German: Findet heraus, wer sie geschickt hat und bringt sie dazu, für uns zu spionieren.
TEXT.Italian: Find out who sent her and make her spy on them for us.
TEXT.Spanish: Find out who sent her and make her spy on them for us.

TEXT.English: 50%: -1 to the Relations with a random player[NEWLINE]50%: +1 to the Relations with a random player
TEXT.French: 50% : -1 aux relations avec un joueur aléatoire[NEWLINE]50%: +1 aux relations avec un joueur aléatoire
TEXT.German: 50%: -1 auf die Beziehungen mit einem zufälligen Spieler[NEWLINE]50%: +1 auf die Beziehungen mit einem zufälligen Spieler
TEXT.Italian: 50%: -1 to the Relations with a random player[NEWLINE]50%: +1 to the Relations with a random player
TEXT.Spanish: 50%: -1 to the Relations with a random player[NEWLINE]50%: +1 to the Relations with a random player

TEXT.English: Let her go.
TEXT.French: Libérez-le.
TEXT.German: Lasst sie gehen.
TEXT.Italian: Let her go.
TEXT.Spanish: Let her go.

TEXT.English: She managed to sneak past my guards? We need people with such potential. Make her an offer she can't refuse.
TEXT.French: S'il a réussi à s'infiltrer malgré les gardes, c'est qu'il est assez expérimenté pour être recruté. Faites-lui une offre qu'il ne pourra pas refuser.
TEXT.German: Sie hat es geschafft, an meinen Wachen vorbeizukommen? Leute mit solchem Potential können wir gebrauchen. Macht ihr ein Angebot, das sie nicht ablehnen kann.
TEXT.Italian: She managed to sneak past my guards? We need people with such potential. Make her an offer she can't refuse.
TEXT.Spanish: She managed to sneak past my guards? We need people with such potential. Make her an offer she can't refuse.

TEXT.English: Receive an Assassin
TEXT.French: Obtenez un assassin
TEXT.German: Erhalte einen Meuchelmörder
TEXT.Italian: Receive an Assassin
TEXT.Spanish: Receive an Assassin

TEXT.English: Send the assassin to the necromancers. New slaves is always good news.
TEXT.French: Envoyez l'assassin aux nécromanciens. Nous avons toujours besoin de nouveaux esclaves.
TEXT.German: Send the assassin to the necromancers. New slaves is always good news.
TEXT.Italian: Send the assassin to the necromancers. New slaves is always good news.
TEXT.Spanish: Send the assassin to the necromancers. New slaves is always good news.

TEXT.English: Our dungeon in %s2_city is so full of criminals that there is barely enough room for all inmates. Escapes, fights and assaults on guards are all reported.
TEXT.French: Notre prison à %s2_city est si remplie que la place manque pour les nouveaux prisonniers. Les évasions, les combats et les attaques sur les gardes deviennent monnaie courante.
TEXT.German: Unser Verlies in %s2_city ist so überfüllt, das kaum noch Platz für alle da ist. Es wird von Ausbrüchen, Kämpfen und Übergriffen auf die Wachen wird berichtet.
TEXT.Italian: Our dungeon in %s2_city is so full of criminals that there is barely enough room for all inmates. Escapes, fights and assaults on guards are all reported.
TEXT.Spanish: Our dungeon in %s2_city is so full of criminals that there is barely enough room for all inmates. Escapes, fights and assaults on guards are all reported.

TEXT.English: Who cares? A dungeon is not supposed to be a comfortable inn.
TEXT.French: Et alors ? C'est une prison, pas une taverne.
TEXT.German: Wen kümmert's? Ein Verlies ist nicht als gemütliche Kneipe gedacht, oder?
TEXT.Italian: Who cares? A dungeon is not supposed to be a comfortable inn.
TEXT.Spanish: Who cares? A dungeon is not supposed to be a comfortable inn.

TEXT.English: Hire more guards and expand the dungeons prisoner capacity.
TEXT.French: Recrutez plus de gardes et faites bâtir une extension avec plus de cellules.
TEXT.German: Heuert mehr Wachleute an und erhöht die Gefangenkapazität.
TEXT.Italian: Hire more guards and expand the dungeons prisoner capacity.
TEXT.Spanish: Hire more guards and expand the dungeons prisoner capacity.

TEXT.English: Release all small-time crooks, so there is enough room for true criminals and thugs.
TEXT.French: Relâchez tous les petits escrocs. Ça fera de la place pour les vrais criminels et bandits.
TEXT.German: Entlasst alle kleinen Ganoven, damit für die wirklichen Verbrecher und Halsabschneider genug Platz ist.
TEXT.Italian: Release all small-time crooks, so there is enough room for true criminals and thugs.
TEXT.Spanish: Release all small-time crooks, so there is enough room for true criminals and thugs.

TEXT.English: Make a full effort to reduce a crime rate in the city and teach criminals how to do useful labor.
TEXT.French: Adoptons des mesures de préventions du crime dans les quartiers à risque et lançons un programme de réinsertion des criminels en leur apprenant des métiers utiles.
TEXT.German: Versucht alles, die Verbrechensrate in der Stadt zu verringern, und lasst die Verbrecher spüren, wie sie ihre Energie in echte Arbeit stecken können.
TEXT.Italian: Make a full effort to reduce a crime rate in the city and teach criminals how to do useful labor.
TEXT.Spanish: Make a full effort to reduce a crime rate in the city and teach criminals how to do useful labor.

TEXT.English: Execute the entire dungeon, every last one of them, they are all scum anyway. That will make some space.
TEXT.French: Exécutez tous les prisonniers ! Tous jusqu'au dernier ! Ce n'est que de la vermine ! Là, on sera enfin tranquilles.
TEXT.German: Exekutiert alle Insassen des Verlieses, bis auf den letzten, das ist ohnehin nur Abschaum. Das sollte etwas Platz schaffen.
TEXT.Italian: Execute the entire dungeon, every last one of them, they are all scum anyway. That will make some space.
TEXT.Spanish: Execute the entire dungeon, every last one of them, they are all scum anyway. That will make some space.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]25% Chance the City Revolts
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]1 chance sur 4 que la ville se révolte
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]25% Chance eines Aufstands in der Stadt
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]25% Chance the City Revolts
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]25% Chance the City Revolts

TEXT.English: Some locals in your empire have discovered that the nearby mound is actually an ancient burial site for some forgotten warrior! They are fearful of the consequences of disturbing the grave.
TEXT.French: Des citoyens de votre empire ont découvert qu'une colline proche est en fait le tumulus élevé pour un guerrier d'une ère oubliée. Ils sont effrayés des possibles conséquences s'ils venaient à déranger le tombeau.
TEXT.German: Einige Einheimische haben in Eurem Reich entdeckt, dass eine nahegelegene Anhöhe eigentlich eine Begräbnisstätte irgendeines vergessenen Kriegers aus alten Zeiten ist. Sie haben Angst vor den Konsequenzen, sollten sie die Totenruhe stören.
TEXT.Italian: Some locals in your empire have discovered that the nearby mound is actually an ancient burial site for some forgotten warrior! They are fearful of the consequences of disturbing the grave.
TEXT.Spanish: Some locals in your empire have discovered that the nearby mound is actually an ancient burial site for some forgotten warrior! They are fearful of the consequences of disturbing the grave.

TEXT.English: Let the warrior's bones rest in peace.
TEXT.French: Laissez la sépulture en paix.
TEXT.German: Lasst die Gebeine des Kriegers in Frieden ruhen.
TEXT.Italian: Let the warrior's bones rest in peace.
TEXT.Spanish: Let the warrior's bones rest in peace.

TEXT.English: An ancient warrior, this must be one of our ancestors lost to history! Set up a memorial in their honor.
TEXT.French: Un ancient gerrier ? Ça doit être un de nos prestigieux ancêtres qui a été oublié depuis. Fondons un mémorial en son honneur !
TEXT.German: Ein Krieger aus längst vergangener Zeit. Das muss einer unserer Vorfahren sein, dessen Andenken in der Geschichte verloren gegangen ist. Errichtet eine Gedenkstätte!
TEXT.Italian: An ancient warrior, this must be one of our ancestors lost to history! Set up a memorial in their honor.
TEXT.Spanish: An ancient warrior, this must be one of our ancestors lost to history! Set up a memorial in their honor.

TEXT.English: 20% Chance an Held Barbarian Skeleton with Heroic Defense Spawns
TEXT.French: 20% Chance an Held Barbarian Skeleton with Heroic Defense Spawns
TEXT.German: 20% Chance, dass ein barbarisches Skelett mit 'Heroischer Verteidigung' auf dem Feld erscheint
TEXT.Italian: 20% Chance an Held Barbarian Skeleton with Heroic Defense Spawns
TEXT.Spanish: 20% Chance an Held Barbarian Skeleton with Heroic Defense Spawns

TEXT.English: Interesting... let's move the grave and set up a tourist attraction. Just to ease the villagers fears, of course.
TEXT.French: Interesting... let's move the grave and set up a tourist attraction. Just to ease the villagers fears, of course.
TEXT.German: Interessant ... verlegt das Grab und macht daraus eine Touristenattraktion. Natürlich nur, um den Dorfbewohnern die Angst zu nehmen.
TEXT.Italian: Interesting... let's move the grave and set up a tourist attraction. Just to ease the villagers fears, of course.
TEXT.Spanish: Interesting... lets move the grave and set up a tourist attraction. Just to ease the villagers fears, of course.

TEXT.English: 90% Chance an Held Barbarian Skeleton with Heroic Defense Spawns[NEWLINE]Tile is Flattened
TEXT.French: 90% Chance an Held Barbarian Skeleton with Heroic Defense Spawns[NEWLINE]Tile is Flattened
TEXT.German: 90% Chance, dass ein barbarisches Skelett mit 'Heroischer Verteidigung' auf dem Feld erscheint.[NEWLINE]Das Feld wird eingeebnet.
TEXT.Italian: 90% Chance an Held Barbarian Skeleton with Heroic Defense Spawns[NEWLINE]Tile is Flattened
TEXT.Spanish: 90% Chance an Held Barbarian Skeleton with Heroic Defense Spawns[NEWLINE]Tile is Flattened

TEXT.English: This warrior was buried before the Age of Ice, let's profit from their death. Loot the grave!
TEXT.French: This warrior was buried before the Age of Ice, let's profit from their death. Loot the grave!
TEXT.German: Dieser Krieger wurde noch vor dem Zeitalter des Eises beerdigt. Lass uns von seinem Tod profitieren. Plündert das Grab!
TEXT.Italian: This warrior was buried before the Age of Ice, let's profit from their death. Loot the grave!
TEXT.Spanish: This warrior was buried before the Age of Ice, let's profit from their death. Loot the grave!

TEXT.English: 40% Chance an Held Barbarian Skeleton with Heroic Defense Spawns
TEXT.French: 40% Chance an Held Barbarian Skeleton with Heroic Defense Spawns
TEXT.German: 40% Chance, dass ein barbarisches Skelett mit 'Heroischer Verteidigung' auf dem Feld erscheint
TEXT.Italian: 40% Chance an Held Barbarian Skeleton with Heroic Defense Spawns
TEXT.Spanish: 40% Chance an Held Barbarian Skeleton with Heroic Defense Spawns

TEXT.English: Ancient Warrior
TEXT.French: Guerrier ancien
TEXT.German: Ancient Warrior
TEXT.Italian: Ancient Warrior
TEXT.Spanish: Ancient Warrior

TEXT.English: While on patrol, your unit stumbles across the laboratory of an isolated golem-maker. As the golem-maker greets you, you see a strange, crazed glint in his eye. Some of the half-finished golems that you can see lying around appear disturbingly...biological. "Welcome," the golem-maker says. "I could use another deft pair of hands for my experiments. My golem assistants are strong, but they lack manual dexterity. Will you help me?"
TEXT.French: While on patrol, your unit stumbles across the laboratory of an isolated golem-maker. As the golem-maker greets you, you see a strange, crazed glint in his eye. Some of the half-finished golems that you can see lying around appear disturbingly...biological. "Welcome," the golem-maker says. "I could use another deft pair of hands for my experiments. My golem assistants are strong, but they lack manual dexterity. Will you help me?"
TEXT.German: Auf einer Patrouille stolpert Eure Einheit über ein Laboratorium eines abgeschieden lebenden Golem-Schöpfers. Bei der Begrüßung bemerkt Eure Einheit einen seltsamen, verrückten Galnz in den Augen des Golem-Bauers. Einige seiner halbfertigen Golems, die herumliegen, wirken beunruhigend ... biologisch. 'Willkommen,' sagt der Golem-Schöpfer. 'ich könnte ein paar geschickte Hände für meine Experimente brauchen. Meine Golems sind als Assistenten stark, aber sie besitzen kein Feingefühl in den Händen. Wollt Ihr mir helfen?"
TEXT.Italian: While on patrol, your unit stumbles across the laboratory of an isolated golem-maker. As the golem-maker greets you, you see a strange, crazed glint in his eye. Some of the half-finished golems that you can see lying around appear disturbingly...biological. "Welcome," the golem-maker says. "I could use another deft pair of hands for my experiments. My golem assistants are strong, but they lack manual dexterity. Will you help me?"
TEXT.Spanish: While on patrol, your unit stumbles across the laboratory of an isolated golem-maker. As the golem-maker greets you, you see a strange, crazed glint in his eye. Some of the half-finished golems that you can see lying around appear disturbingly...biological. "Welcome," the golem-maker says. "I could use another deft pair of hands for my experiments. My golem assistants are strong, but they lack manual dexterity. Will you help me?"

TEXT.English: No, this place makes me nervous. I'm going to leave now.
TEXT.French: No, this place makes me nervous. I'm going to leave now.
TEXT.German: Nein, dieser Ort macht mich nervös. Ich werde Euch nun verlassen.
TEXT.Italian: No, this place makes me nervous. I'm going to leave now.
TEXT.Spanish: No, this place makes me nervous. I'm going to leave now.

TEXT.English: These experiments are an abomination! Kill him, and seize his gold and his magical materials. But watch out for his golems!
TEXT.French: These experiments are an abomination! Kill him, and seize his gold and his magical materials. But watch out for his golems!
TEXT.German: Diese Experimente sind abscheulich. Tötet ihn und nehmt sein Gold und seine magische Ausrüstung. Doch achtet auf die Golems!
TEXT.Italian: These experiments are an abomination! Kill him, and seize his gold and his magical materials. But watch out for his golems!
TEXT.Spanish: These experiments are an abomination! Kill him, and seize his gold and his magical materials. But watch out for his golems!

TEXT.English: Unit Gains Sheut Stones[NEWLINE]2 Barbarian Wood Golems spawns nearby
TEXT.French: Unit Gains Sheut Stones[NEWLINE]2 Barbarian Wood Golems spawns nearby
TEXT.German: Einheit erhält 'Seelensteine'[NEWLINE]2 Barbarische Holzgolems erscheinen in der Nähe
TEXT.Italian: Unit Gains Sheut Stones[NEWLINE]2 Barbarian Wood Golems spawns nearby
TEXT.Spanish: Unit Gains Sheut Stones[NEWLINE]2 Barbarian Wood Golems spawns nearby

TEXT.English: Yes, I will help you.
TEXT.French: Yes, I will help you.
TEXT.German: Ja, ich werde Euch helfen!
TEXT.Italian: Yes, I will help you.
TEXT.Spanish: Yes, I will help you.

TEXT.English: "Oh my, what a perfect specimen! I can't see how I could possibly improve you, my friend. Maybe if I remove this piece...oh no! I broke it!"
TEXT.French: "Oh my, what a perfect specimen! I can't see how I could possibly improve you, my friend. Maybe if I remove this piece...oh no! I broke it!"
TEXT.German: "Oh ja, was für ein perfektes Exemplar! Ich sehe keinen Makel, wie sollte ich dich verbessern. Vielleicht, wenn ich dieses Teil entferne ... oh nein, ich hab's kaputt gemacht!"
TEXT.Italian: "Oh my, what a perfect specimen! I can't see how I could possibly improve you, my friend. Maybe if I remove this piece...oh no! I broke it!"
TEXT.Spanish: "Oh my, what a perfect specimen! I can't see how I could possibly improve you, my friend. Maybe if I remove this piece...oh no! I broke it!"

TEXT.English: "Ah yes, I can see much room for improvement here. Let me just adjust this and tweak that...there!"
TEXT.French: "Ah yes, I can see much room for improvement here. Let me just adjust this and tweak that...there!"
TEXT.German: "Ah ja, ich sehe großes Potential für Verbesserungen hier. Lasst mich einfach das hier anpassen und dort etwas nachbessern ... fein!"
TEXT.Italian: "Ah yes, I can see much room for improvement here. Let me just adjust this and tweak that...there!"
TEXT.Spanish: "Ah yes, I can see much room for improvement here. Let me just adjust this and tweak that...there!"

TEXT.English: "If you'll just hold this intestine while I cast the enchantment .... There we go! It's perfect!"
TEXT.French: "If you'll just hold this intestine while I cast the enchantment .... There we go! It's perfect!"
TEXT.German: "Wenn Ihr mal dieses Organ halten könntet, während ich den Zauber spreche ... Da haben wir's. Perfekt!"
TEXT.Italian: "If you'll just hold this intestine while I cast the enchantment .... There we go! It's perfect!"
TEXT.Spanish: "If you'll just hold this intestine while I cast the enchantment .... There we go! It's perfect!"

TEXT.English: "Just hold this piece for me...no! What are you doing? You dropped it! My experiment is ruined! Now I will need new experimental materials. Golems, seize them! Hold them down while I saw open the skulls. It's a tight space in there, but I have some excellent clockwork that will fit once I remove the useless gray matter."
TEXT.French: "Just hold this piece for me...no! What are you doing? You dropped it! My experiment is ruined! Now I will need new experimental materials. Golems, seize them! Hold them down while I saw open the skulls. It's a tight space in there, but I have some excellent clockwork that will fit once I remove the useless gray matter."
TEXT.German: "Haltet mal dieses Teil für mich ... nein nein! Was machst du? Du hast es fallen lassen! Mein Experiment ist ruiniert! Nun brauche ich neues Ausgangsmaterial. Golems, packt ihn! Haltet ihn unten, während ich den den Schädel aufsäge. ... Er ist zwar etwas eng, aber ich habe ein exzellentes Uhrwerk, dass genau passen wird, sobald ich diese nutzlose graue Masse entfernt habe."
TEXT.Italian: "Just hold this piece for me...no! What are you doing? You dropped it! My experiment is ruined! Now I will need new experimental materials. Golems, seize them! Hold them down while I saw open the skulls. It's a tight space in there, but I have some excellent clockwork that will fit once I remove the useless gray matter."
TEXT.Spanish: "Just hold this piece for me...no! What are you doing? You dropped it! My experiment is ruined! Now I will need new experimental materials. Golems, seize them! Hold them down while I saw open the skulls. It's a tight space in there, but I have some excellent clockwork that will fit once I remove the useless gray matter."

TEXT.English: Younger adults from %s2_city are complaining about the local Elder Council. They claim that its members spend their time telling stories from their youth instead of doing anything useful. They demand representation in the council so that they can direct its work.
TEXT.French: De jeunes adultes de %s2_city se plaingnent de leur Conseil des Anciens. Ils prétendent que ses membres passent leur temps à ressasser les histoires de leur jeunesse au lieu de se montrer utiles. Les jeunes exigent d'être représentés au conseil afin de pouvoir guider son fonctionnement.
TEXT.German: Junge Erwachsene aus %s2_city beschweren sich über den einheimischen Ältestenrat. Sie behaupten, dass die Mitglieder all ihre Zeit darauf verschwenden, alte Kamellen aus ihrer Jugend erzählen, anstatt ihre Zeit sinnvoll zu nutzen. Sie verlangen eine Vertretung im Rat, damit sie dessen Arbeit überwachen und lenken können.
TEXT.Italian: Younger adults from %s2_city are complaining about the local Elder Council. They claim that its members spend their time telling stories from their youth instead of doing anything useful. They demand representation in the council so that they could direct its work.
TEXT.Spanish: Younger adults from %s2_city are complaining about the local Elder Council. They claim that its members spend their time telling stories from their youth instead of doing anything useful. They demand representation in the council so that they could direct its work.

TEXT.English: There is a reason why it's called an Elder Council. We shall keep the tradition.
TEXT.French: Il y une raison pour laquelle on appelle ça le Conseil des « Anciens ». Nous conserverons cette tradition.
TEXT.German: Es gibt einen Grund dafür, dass der Ältestenrat so heißt. Wir werden an der Tradition nichts ändern.
TEXT.Italian: There is a reason why it's called an Elder Council. We shall keep the tradition.
TEXT.Spanish: There is a reason why it's called an Elder Council. We shall keep the tradition.

TEXT.English: Let some responsible younger citizens join the council.
TEXT.French: Faites en sorte que des citoyens-modèles plus jeunes rejoignent le conseil.
TEXT.German: Lasst einige der jüngeren, verantwortungsbewussten Bürger dem Rat beitreten.
TEXT.Italian: Let some responsible younger citizens join the council.
TEXT.Spanish: Let some responsible younger citizens join the council.

TEXT.English: Get rid of the elders. They have no idea how today's world works.
TEXT.French: Débarassez-vous des anciens. Il n'ont pas la moindre idée de la façon dont le monde d'aujourd'hui fonctionne.
TEXT.German: Weg mit den Alten. Sie haben doch keine Ahnung mehr, wie die heutige Welt funktioniert.
TEXT.Italian: Get rid of the elders. They have no idea how today's world works.
TEXT.Spanish: Get rid of the elders. They have no idea how today's world works.

TEXT.English: The state should take care that the elders do their job. Assign some official to the council.
TEXT.French: L'État devrait s'assurer que les anciens font leur boulot. Qu'on assigne un fonctionnaire au conseil.
TEXT.German: Der Staat wird sich darum kümmern, dass die Ältesten ihren Job ernst nehmen. Teilt dem Rat einen Vertreter der Behörden zu.
TEXT.Italian: The state should take care that the elders do their job. Assign some official to the council.
TEXT.Spanish: The state should take care that the elders do their job. Assign some official to the council.

TEXT.English: An ancient cookbook from the Age of Magic has been discovered in the library of %s2_city.
TEXT.French: An ancient cookbook from the Age of Magic has been discovered in the library of %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Ein uraltes Kochbuch aus dem Zeitalter der Magie wurde in der Bibliothek von %s2_city entdeckt.
TEXT.Italian: An ancient cookbook from the Age of Magic has been discovered in the library of %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: An ancient cookbook from the Age of Magic has been discovered in the library of %s2_city.

TEXT.English: That's great news - I have always wanted to know what people from that lost age ate.
TEXT.French: That's great news - I have always wanted to know what people from that lost age ate.
TEXT.German: Das sind großartige Neuigkeiten - Ich wollte schon immer wissen, was die Leute eines vergangenen Zeitalters gegessen haben.
TEXT.Italian: That's great news - I have always wanted to know what people from that lost age ate.
TEXT.Spanish: That's great news - I have always wanted to know what people from that lost age ate.

TEXT.English: That can not be a good omen. This book must be cursed. Have it burned.
TEXT.French: That can not be a good omen. This book must be cursed. Have it burned.
TEXT.German: Das kann kein gutes Omen sein. Dieses Buch ist sicherlich mit einem Fluch belegt. Verbrennt es.
TEXT.Italian: That can not be a good omen. This book must be cursed. Have it burned.
TEXT.Spanish: That can not be a good omen. This book must be cursed. Have it burned.

TEXT.English: A member of the Elder Council in %s2_city recently died. He was an respected member, how shall we honor his death?
TEXT.French: Un membre du Conseil des Anciens de %s2_city vient de décéder. Il était très respecté. Comment allons-nous commémorer son décès ?
TEXT.German: Ein Mitglied des Ältestenrats von %s2_city ist kürzlich verstorben. Er war ein geachtetes Mitglied, wie sollen wir seinen Tod ehren?
TEXT.Italian: A member of the Elder Council in %s2_city recently died. He was an respected member, how shall we honor his death?
TEXT.Spanish: A member of the Elder Council in %s2_city recently died. He was an respected member, how shall we honor his death?

TEXT.English: Why are you bothering me with this?
TEXT.French: Pourquoi venez-vous me déranger avec ça ?
TEXT.German: Warum nervt man mich mit so etwas?
TEXT.Italian: Why are you bothering me with this?
TEXT.Spanish: Why are you bothering me with this?

TEXT.English: We will fund a lavish funeral in celebration of the man's life.
TEXT.French: Nous allons organiser des funérailles somptueuses en honneur à la vie de cet homme.
TEXT.German: Wir werden ein aufwendiges Begräbnis aurichten, um das Leben des Mannes zu feiern.
TEXT.Italian: We will fund a lavish funeral in celebration of the man's life.
TEXT.Spanish: We will fund a lavish funeral in celebration of the man's life.

TEXT.English: He can serve me in the afterlife.
TEXT.French: Il pourra me servir dans l'au-delà.
TEXT.German: Er kann mir doch noch nach dem Tod dienen, oder?
TEXT.Italian: He can serve me in the afterlife.
TEXT.Spanish: He can serve me in the afterlife.

TEXT.English: Receive a Skeleton
TEXT.French: Obtenir un Squelette
TEXT.German: Erhalte ein Skelett
TEXT.Italian: Receive a Skeleton
TEXT.Spanish: Receive a Skeleton

TEXT.English: Search the city for a new member for the Elder Council.
TEXT.French: Fouillez la ville à la recherche d'un remplaçant pour le Conseil des Anciens.
TEXT.German: Sucht in der Stadt nach einem neuen Mitglied für den Ältestenrat.
TEXT.Italian: Search the city for a new member for the Elder Council.
TEXT.Spanish: Search the city for a new member for the Elder Council.

TEXT.English: A very promising journeyman in %s2_city is infuriating local master craftsman by wasting his time on making jewelry instead of weapons and tools.
TEXT.French: A very promising journeyman in %s2_city is infuriating local master craftsman by wasting his time on making jewelry instead of weapons and tools.
TEXT.German: In %s2_city raubt ein vielversprechender Geselle seinem Meisterausstatter den letzten Nerv, indem er Zeit damit verschwendet, Schmuck anstelle von Waffen und Werkzeugen herzustellen.
TEXT.Italian: A very promising journeyman in %s2_city is infuriating local master craftsman by wasting his time on making jewelry instead of weapons and tools.
TEXT.Spanish: A very promising journeyman in %s2_city is infuriating local master craftsman by wasting his time on making jewelry instead of weapons and tools.

TEXT.English: We could use a service of a skilled jeweler. Fund him his own workshop.
TEXT.French: We could use a service of a skilled jeweler. Fund him his own workshop.
TEXT.German: Die Dienste eines fähigen Juweliers können wir gebrauchen. Finanziert ihm seine eigene Werkstatt.
TEXT.Italian: We could use a service of a skilled jeweler. Fund him his own workshop.
TEXT.Spanish: We could use a service of a skilled jeweler. Fund him his own workshop.

TEXT.English: He should return to his work as a blacksmith.
TEXT.French: He should return to his work as a blacksmith.
TEXT.German: Er sollte zu seinen Schmiedearbeiten zurückkehren.
TEXT.Italian: He should return to his work as a blacksmith.
TEXT.Spanish: He should return to his work as a blacksmith.

TEXT.English: Let him do both by creating and then decorating high quality weapons with jewels and inlays to increase their value for the glory of Kilmorph.
TEXT.French: Let him do both by creating and then decorating high quality weapons with jewels and inlays to increase their value for the glory of Kilmorph.
TEXT.German: Er soll beides machen. Hochwertige Waffen herstellen und sie dann mit Juwelen und Einlagen schmücken. Kilmorph zu Ehren!
TEXT.Italian: Let him do both by creating and then decorating high quality weapons with jewels and inlays to increase their value for the glory of Kilmorph.
TEXT.Spanish: Let him do both by creating and then decorating high quality weapons with jewels and inlays to increase their value for the glory of Kilmorph.

TEXT.English: One of the lawyers in %s2_city is gaining renown for his eloquent, moving and honest speeches. People say he raises the use of language to the rank of art.
TEXT.French: One of the lawyers in %s2_city is gaining renown for his eloquent, moving and honest speeches. People say he raises the use of language to the rank of art.
TEXT.German: Einer unsere Rechtssprecher in %s2_city hat sich durch seine eloquenten, bewegenden und ehrlichen Ansprachen einiges Ansehen verschafft. Die Leute sagen, er erhebt die Verwendung der Sprache zur Kunst.
TEXT.Italian: One of the lawyers in %s2_city is gaining renown for his eloquent, moving and honest speeches. People say he raises the use of language to the rank of art.
TEXT.Spanish: One of the lawyers in %s2_city is gaining renown for his eloquent, moving and honest speeches. People say he raises the use of language to the rank of art.

TEXT.English: I suppose that's good news as long as he does not use his talent against us.
TEXT.French: I suppose that's good news as long as he does not use his talent against us.
TEXT.German: Ich denke doch, das sind gute Nachrichten. Solang er sein Talent nicht gegen Uns einsetzt.
TEXT.Italian: I suppose that's good news as long as he does not use his talent against us.
TEXT.Spanish: I suppose that's good news as long as he does not use his talent against us.

TEXT.English: Our chief architect suggests adding new decorations to the palace.
TEXT.French: Our chief architect suggests adding new decorations to the palace.
TEXT.German: Unser Oberster Architekt schlägt vor, den Palast etwas auszuschmücken.
TEXT.Italian: Our chief architect suggests adding new decorations to the palace.
TEXT.Spanish: Our chief architect suggests adding new decorations to the palace.

TEXT.English: We could add some stone statues.
TEXT.French: We could add some stone statues.
TEXT.German: Wir könnten einige Steinstatuen aufstellen.
TEXT.Italian: We could add some stone statues.
TEXT.Spanish: We could add some stone statues.

TEXT.English: How about some marble sculptures.
TEXT.French: How about some marble sculptures.
TEXT.German: Wie wärs mit ein paar Marmorskulpturen?
TEXT.Italian: How about some marble sculptures.
TEXT.Spanish: How about some marble sculptures.

TEXT.English: Maybe some golden ornaments here and there would do the trick.
TEXT.French: Maybe some golden ornaments here and there would do the trick.
TEXT.German: Vielleicht helfen einige goldene Ornamente?
TEXT.Italian: Maybe some golden ornaments here and there would do the trick.
TEXT.Spanish: Maybe some golden ornaments here and there would do the trick.

TEXT.English: I think bronze statues would do just fine.
TEXT.French: I think bronze statues would do just fine.
TEXT.German: Ich denke, Bronzestatuen sind genau das Richtige.
TEXT.Italian: I think bronze statues would do just fine.
TEXT.Spanish: I think bronze statues would do just fine.

TEXT.English: I'm afraid we can not afford this.
TEXT.French: I'm afraid we can not afford this.
TEXT.German: Tut mir leid. Das können wir uns nicht leisten.
TEXT.Italian: I'm afraid we can not afford this.
TEXT.Spanish: I'm afraid we can not afford this.

TEXT.English: Miners near the city of %s2_city have found a strange new mineral all over the mine. They call it Uranium, and it glows slightly in the dark. Unfortunately it is slowly poisoning them and their tools. What shall we do?
TEXT.French: Miners near the city of %s2_city have found a strange new mineral all over the mine. They call it Uranium, and it glows slightly in the dark. Unfortunately it is slowly poisoning them and their tools. What shall we do?
TEXT.German: Minenarbeiter haben in einer Mine nahe %s2_city große Mengen eines seltsamen neues Minerals gefunden. Sie nennen es Uran, und es glüht im Dunkeln. Leider scheint es sie und ihre Werkzeuge langsam zu vergiften. Was sollen wir tun?
TEXT.Italian: Miners near the city of %s2_city have found a strange new mineral all over the mine. They call it Uranium, and it glows slightly in the dark. Unfortunately it is slowly poisoning them and their tools. What shall we do?
TEXT.Spanish: Miners near the city of %s2_city have found a strange new mineral all over the mine. They call it Uranium, and it glows slightly in the dark. Unfortunately it is slowly poisoning them and their tools. What shall we do?

TEXT.English: Our Earth adepts should be able to find a way to use this Uranium safely.
TEXT.French: Our Earth adepts should be able to find a way to use this Uranium safely.
TEXT.German: Unsere Erd-Adepten sollten einen Weg finden, wie wir das Uran sicher nutzen können.
TEXT.Italian: Our Earth adepts should be able to find a way to use this Uranium safely.
TEXT.Spanish: Our Earth adepts should be able to find a way to use this Uranium safely.

TEXT.English: Station a Life adept at the mine to keep the miners healthy.
TEXT.French: Station a Life adept at the mine to keep the miners healthy.
TEXT.German: Stationiert einen Lebens-Adept bei der Mine, um die Minenarbeiter gesund zu halten.
TEXT.Italian: Station a Life adept at the mine to keep the miners healthy.
TEXT.Spanish: Station a Life adept at the mine to keep the miners healthy.

TEXT.English: Safety first - take the necessary precautions to protect our miners.
TEXT.French: Safety first - take the necessary precautions to protect our miners.
TEXT.German: Sicherheit geht vor - ergreift die notwendigen Vorkehrungen zum Schutz der Bergleute!
TEXT.Italian: Safety first - take the necessary precautions to protect our miners.
TEXT.Spanish: Safety first - take the necessary precautions to protect our miners.

TEXT.English: Keep it quiet, but KEEP them working.
TEXT.French: Keep it quiet, but KEEP them working.
TEXT.German: Nicht jammern, sondern arbeiten!
TEXT.Italian: Keep it quiet, but KEEP them working.
TEXT.Spanish: Keep it quiet, but KEEP them working.

TEXT.English: A desert area floodplain near the city of %s2_city has a thick, black, stinking, oily liquid welling up from the ground in many places. It is reducing available farmland.
TEXT.French: A desert area floodplain near the city of %s2_city has a thick, black, stinking, oily liquid welling up from the ground in many places. It is reducing available farmland.
TEXT.German: In einem unbewohnten Feuchtgebiet nahe %s2_city tritt eine dickflüssige, schwarze und stinkende Flüssigkeit aus dem Baden. Dieses 'Öl' verringert die Menge an verfügbarem Ackerland.
TEXT.Italian: A desert area floodplain near the city of %s2_city has a thick, black, stinking, oily liquid welling up from the ground in many places. It is reducing available farmland.
TEXT.Spanish: A desert area floodplain near the city of %s2_city has a thick, black, stinking, oily liquid welling up from the ground in many places. It is reducing available farmland.

TEXT.English: We'll never find a use for this worthless "oil".
TEXT.French: We'll never find a use for this worthless "oil".
TEXT.German: Wir werden für dieses nutzlose 'Öl' niemals irgendeine Verwendung haben.
TEXT.Italian: We'll never find a use for this worthless "oil".
TEXT.Spanish: We'll never find a use for this worthless "oil".

TEXT.English: I wonder if this "oil" burns?
TEXT.French: I wonder if this "oil" burns?
TEXT.German: Ich frage mich: Brennt dieses 'Öl'??
TEXT.Italian: I wonder if this "oil" burns?
TEXT.Spanish: I wonder if this "oil" burns?

TEXT.English: Hmmm, this "oil" may help us lubricate our machinery better.
TEXT.French: Hmmm, this "oil" may help us lubricate our machinery better.
TEXT.German: Hmmm, dieses "Öl" könnte zum Schmieren unserer Maschinen genutzt werden.
TEXT.Italian: Hmmm, this "oil" may help us lubricate our machinery better.
TEXT.Spanish: Hmmm, this "oil" may help us lubricate our machinery better.

TEXT.English: Massive storms are slowly destroying our windmills near the city of %s2_city. Eyewitnesses say the winds sound like they come from the very Vaults of Hell. What can we do?
TEXT.French: Massive storms are slowly destroying our windmills near the city of %s2_city. Eyewitnesses say the winds sound like they come from the very Vaults of Hell. What can we do?
TEXT.German: Massive Stürme zerstören nach und nach unsere Windmühlen in der Nähe von %s2_city. Augenzeugen berichten, dass der Wind klinge, als käme er direkt aus den Toren der Hölle. Was sollen wir tun?
TEXT.Italian: Massive storms are slowly destroying our windmills near the city of %s2_city. Eyewitnesses say the winds sound like they come from the very Vaults of Hell. What can we do?
TEXT.Spanish: Massive storms are slowly destroying our windmills near the city of %s2_city. Eyewitnesses say the winds sound like they come from the very Vaults of Hell. What can we do?

TEXT.English: Our Air adepts can redirect the winds until the storms subside.
TEXT.French: Our Air adepts can redirect the winds until the storms subside.
TEXT.German: Unsere Luft-Adepten können diese Winde ablenken, bis die Stürme abklingen.
TEXT.Italian: Our Air adepts can redirect the winds until the storms subside.
TEXT.Spanish: Our Air adepts can redirect the winds until the storms subside.

TEXT.English: Sacrifice a soul to appease these winds.
TEXT.French: Sacrifice a soul to appease these winds.
TEXT.German: Opfert jemanden, um die Winde zu besänftigen!
TEXT.Italian: Sacrifice a soul to appease these winds.
TEXT.Spanish: Sacrifice a soul to appease these winds.

TEXT.English: What can we do? Let the storms run their course and rebuild.
TEXT.French: What can we do? Let the storms run their course and rebuild.
TEXT.German: Was können wir schon tun? Lasst diese Stürme ihre Arbeit tun und baut alles wieder auf!
TEXT.Italian: What can we do? Let the storms run their course and rebuild.
TEXT.Spanish: What can we do? Let the storms run their course and rebuild.

TEXT.English: Logging operations in the forests near the city of %s2_city are in danger. Treants are enraged at tree cuttings and their attacks have caught us by surprise. Loggers are fleeing and buildings being destroyed.
TEXT.French: Logging operations in the forests near the city of %s2_city are in danger. Treants are enraged at tree cuttings and their attacks have caught us by surprise. Loggers are fleeing and buildings being destroyed.
TEXT.German: Holzfällerarbeiten in den Wäldern nahe %s2_city sind gefährdet. Baumhirten sind durch das Fällen von Bäumen aufgebracht und haben uns mit ihren Angriffen überrascht. Die Holzfäller sind geflohen und ihre Lager wurden zerstört.
TEXT.Italian: Logging operations in the forests near the city of %s2_city are in danger. Treants are enraged at tree cuttings and their attacks have caught us by surprise. Loggers are fleeing and buildings being destroyed.
TEXT.Spanish: Logging operations in the forests near the city of %s2_city are in danger. Treants are enraged at tree cuttings and their attacks have caught us by surprise. Loggers are fleeing and buildings being destroyed.

TEXT.English: Quick, our Nature adepts should be able to calm them down.
TEXT.French: Quick, our Nature adepts should be able to calm them down.
TEXT.German: Schnell, unsere Natur-Adepten sollten die Baumhirten beruhigen können.
TEXT.Italian: Quick, our Nature adepts should be able to calm them down.
TEXT.Spanish: Quick, our Nature adepts should be able to calm them down.

TEXT.English: Rush our priests there to convince the treants we replant as well as cut.
TEXT.French: Rush our priests there to convince the treants we replant as well as cut.
TEXT.German: Schickt unsere Priester schnell hin, um die Baumhirten zu überzeugen, dass wir alles wieder aufforsten, so wie wir es gefällt haben.
TEXT.Italian: Rush our priests there to convince the treants we replant as well as cut.
TEXT.Spanish: Rush our priests there to convince the treants we replant as well as cut.

TEXT.English: Our troops cannot reach there in time. We shall just have to rebuild our lumbermills.
TEXT.French: Our troops cannot reach there in time. We shall just have to rebuild our lumbermills.
TEXT.German: Unsere Truppen kommen sowieso nicht schnell genug dorthin. Wir müssen als unsere Sägewerke neu aufbauen.
TEXT.Italian: Our troops cannot reach there in time. We shall just have to rebuild our lumbermills.
TEXT.Spanish: Our troops cannot reach there in time. We shall just have to rebuild our lumbermills.

TEXT.English: Treants enraged by tree cuttings have attacked the %s1_civ_adjective logging operations.
TEXT.French: Treants enraged by tree cuttings have attacked the %s1_civ_adjective logging operations.
TEXT.German: Durch das Fällen von Bäumen aufgebrachte Baumhirten haben Waldarbeiten gewaltsam unterbunden. Das betroffene Gebiet ist %s1_civ_adjective.
TEXT.Italian: Treants enraged by tree cuttings have attacked the %s1_civ_adjective logging operations.
TEXT.Spanish: Treants enraged by tree cuttings have attacked the %s1_civ_adjective logging operations.

TEXT.English: An unexpectedly fierce storm has struck land near the city of %s2_city, devastating our coastal waters.
TEXT.French: An unexpectedly fierce storm has struck land near the city of %s2_city, devastating our coastal waters.
TEXT.German: Ein unerwartet starker Sturm hat ein Gebiet in der Nähe der Stadt %s2_city getroffen und unsere Küstengewässer verwüstet.
TEXT.Italian: An unexpectedly fierce storm has struck land near the city of %s2_city, devastating our coastal waters.
TEXT.Spanish: An unexpectedly fierce storm has struck land near the city of %s2_city, devastating our coastal waters.

TEXT.English: A disaster. We shall have to repair or rebuild almost everything there.
TEXT.French: A disaster. We shall have to repair or rebuild almost everything there.
TEXT.German: Ein Desaster. Wir werden alles nahezu alles vor Ort wieder aufbauen müssen.
TEXT.Italian: A disaster. We shall have to repair or rebuild almost everything there.
TEXT.Spanish: A disaster. We shall have to repair or rebuild almost everything there.

TEXT.English: A disaster. We shall have to rebuild our pirate cove.
TEXT.French: A disaster. We shall have to rebuild our pirate cove.
TEXT.German: Eine Katastrophe. Wir werden unseren Piratenunterschlupf reparieren
TEXT.Italian: A disaster. We shall have to rebuild our pirate cove.
TEXT.Spanish: A disaster. We shall have to rebuild our pirate cove.

TEXT.English: An uxpectedly fierce storm has devastated %s1_civ_adjective fishing operations.
TEXT.French: An uxpectedly fierce storm has devastated %s1_civ_adjective fishing operations.
TEXT.German: Ein unerwartet heftiger Sturm hat %s1_civ_adjective Seeausbauten verwüstet.
TEXT.Italian: An uxpectedly fierce storm has devastated %s1_civ_adjective fishing operations.
TEXT.Spanish: An uxpectedly fierce storm has devastated %s1_civ_adjective fishing operations.

TEXT.English: The swamps near the city of %s2_city have an abundant supply of peat.
TEXT.French: The swamps near the city of %s2_city have an abundant supply of peat.
TEXT.German: Die Sümpfe nahe der Stadt %s2_city enthalten reichlich Torf.
TEXT.Italian: The swamps near the city of %s2_city have an abundant supply of peat.
TEXT.Spanish: The swamps near the city of %s2_city have an abundant supply of peat.

TEXT.English: That's good news.
TEXT.French: That's good news.
TEXT.German: Tolle Neuigkeiten.
TEXT.Italian: That's good news.
TEXT.Spanish: That's good news.

TEXT.English: Millers using the windmills near the city of %s2_city have discovered a more efficient way to make bread flour with less waste.
TEXT.French: Millers using the windmills near the city of %s2_city have discovered a more efficient way to make bread flour with less waste.
TEXT.German: Müller in der Nä von %s2_city haben einen effizienteren Weg gefunden, um Mehl mit weniger Verlust herzustellen. Das bedeutet mehr Brot.
TEXT.Italian: Millers using the windmills near the city of %s2_city have discovered a more efficient way to make bread flour with less waste.
TEXT.Spanish: Millers using the windmills near the city of %s2_city have discovered a more efficient way to make bread flour with less waste.

TEXT.English: Now all we need is the jug of wine and thou, as the poet once said.
TEXT.French: Now all we need is the jug of wine and thou, as the poet once said.
TEXT.German: Nun brauchen wir nur noch einen Krug Wein und etwas Liebe, wie die Dichter sagen.
TEXT.Italian: Now all we need is the jug of wine and thou, as the poet once said.
TEXT.Spanish: Now all we need is the jug of wine and thou, as the poet once said.

TEXT.English: Small amounts of silver have been discovered near the workshops of the city of %s2_city. The workshops are using it to increase the value of their products.
TEXT.French: Small amounts of silver have been discovered near the workshops of the city of %s2_city. The workshops are using it to increase the value of their products.
TEXT.German: Geringe Mengen an Silber sind in der Nähe der Werkstätten von %s2_city entdeckt worden. Die Werkstätten nutzen es, um den Wert ihrer Waren zu erhöhen.
TEXT.Italian: Small amounts of silver have been discovered near the workshops of the city of %s2_city. The workshops are using it to increase the value of their products.
TEXT.Spanish: Small amounts of silver have been discovered near the workshops of the city of %s2_city. The workshops are using it to increase the value of their products.

TEXT.English: Good, but don't let it start a silver rush.
TEXT.French: Good, but don't let it start a silver rush.
TEXT.German: Gut gut, aber dass es mir ja nicht zu einem Silberrausch kommt!
TEXT.Italian: Good, but don't let it start a silver rush.
TEXT.Spanish: Good, but don't let it start a silver rush.

TEXT.English: The swamps near the city of %s2_city have a plethora of large edible frogs. Their legs have become a delicacy.
TEXT.French: The swamps near the city of %s2_city have a plethora of large edible frogs. Their legs have become a delicacy.
TEXT.German: Nahe der Stadt %s2_city ist es in den Sümpfen zu einem Äberangebot an essbaren Fröschen gekommen. Ihre Schenkel entpuppen sich als beliebte Delikatesse.
TEXT.Italian: The swamps near the city of %s2_city have a plethora of large edible frogs. Their legs have become a delicacy.
TEXT.Spanish: The swamps near the city of %s2_city have a plethora of large edible frogs. Their legs have become a delicacy.

TEXT.English: They do taste like chicken, don't they?
TEXT.French: They do taste like chicken, don't they?
TEXT.German: Schmeckt wie Hühnchen, oder?
TEXT.Italian: They do taste like chicken, don't they?
TEXT.Spanish: They do taste like chicken, don't they?

TEXT.English: Frog legs have become a delicacy in %s1_civ_adjective lands.
TEXT.French: Frog legs have become a delicacy in %s1_civ_adjective lands.
TEXT.German: Froschschenkel sind zu einer Delikatesse geworden. Die Idee dazu war %s1_civ_adjective.
TEXT.Italian: Frog legs have become a delicacy in %s1_civ_adjective lands.
TEXT.Spanish: Frog legs have become a delicacy in %s1_civ_adjective lands.

TEXT.English: An issue long thought decided is being discussed again amongst our people - risen from the dead, so to speak. Heated arguments are breaking out daily, dividing family and friends.
TEXT.French: Une question que l'on croyait résolue depuis longtemps est à nouveau discutée au sein de notre peuple - ressuscité d'entre les morts, pour ainsi dire. De vives disputes éclatent quotidiennement, divisant famille et amis.
TEXT.German: Eine Streitfrage, die schon lange als geklärt betrachtet war, wird nun wieder von Eurem Volk diskutiert. Quasi wiederauferstanden. Täglich brechen erhitzte Debatten aus, die Familien und Freundschaften zerstören.
TEXT.Italian: Una questione a lungo ritenuta risolta viene nuovamente discussa tra la nostra gente - resuscitata dai morti, per così dire. Ogni giorno scoppiano accese discussioni che dividono familiari e amici.
TEXT.Spanish: Un tema que se había pensado durante mucho tiempo se está discutiendo nuevamente entre nuestro pueblo, resucitado de entre los muertos, por así decirlo. A diario estallan acaloradas discusiones que dividen a familiares y amigos.

TEXT.English: Our stability is more important than those raising this issue. Let's have lunch.
TEXT.French: Notre stabilité est plus importante que ceux qui soulèvent cette question. Alors, dîner.
TEXT.German: Unsere Stabilität ist wichtiger als diese Debatten wieder aufzunehmen. Essenszeit!
TEXT.Italian: La nostra stabilità è più importante di coloro che sollevano la questione. Allora, cena!
TEXT.Spanish: Nuestra estabilidad es más importante que quienes plantean esta cuestión. ¡Comamos!

TEXT.English: I have an idea for a series of public ice sculptures using those causing this unrest.
TEXT.French: Faites des sculptures publiques de glace de ces dissidents.
TEXT.German: Ich hätte da eine Idee für eine Serie von Eisskulpturen, die man aus den Aufrührern machen könnte.
TEXT.Italian: Realizza sculture di ghiaccio pubbliche da questi dissidenti.
TEXT.Spanish: Haga esculturas de hielo públicas de estos disidentes.

TEXT.English: Let's show the people real necromancy and stop this irritation.
TEXT.French: Demandez à nos nécromanciens de faire une démonstration. Sur eux.
TEXT.German: Zeigt den Leuten, was wahre Nekromantie ist und beendet diese Störung der Ruhe.
TEXT.Italian: Presentateli ai negromanti di corte.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Quieren una demostración de nuestros nigromantes? ¿Quién soy yo para negarlos?

TEXT.English: It's hard to talk and spread dissension when your lungs are filled with water.
TEXT.French: Noyez-les. Les Overlords les béniront par le baptême.
TEXT.German: Es ist ziemlich schwer, Unfrieden zu stiften, wenn die Lungen mit Wasser gefüllt sind, richtig?
TEXT.Italian: Lasciali nuotare con i pesci.
TEXT.Spanish: El bautismo por inmersión está subestimado. Elimina su descontento. Permanentemente.

TEXT.English: Dissent of such a random nature is a threat to our society and will not be tolerated. Crackdown on this and train our priests better to avoid this happening ever again.
TEXT.French: Notre société ne tolérera pas une telle dissidence. J'espère que nos prêtres ne permettront plus jamais cela.
TEXT.German: Uneinigkeit bei so einem beliebigen Thema ist eine Gefahr für unsere Gesellschaft und wird nicht toleriert. Veranstaltet Razzien und bildet unsere Priester besser aus, damit so etwas nicht wieder vorkommt.
TEXT.Italian: Il dissenso non sarà tollerato. I preti manterranno l'Ordine!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Nadie espera la Inquisición [civilization name]!

TEXT.English: Just let it be - maybe it will die away again.
TEXT.French: Ignorez-le et laissez-le mourir.
TEXT.German: Lasst sie einfach ... vielleicht legt sich das ja von allein wieder.
TEXT.Italian: Ignoralo e lascialo morire.
TEXT.Spanish: Ignóralo y déjalo morir.

TEXT.English: The Emperor has been expecting you. Welcome home.
TEXT.French: L'Empereur vous attendait. Bienvenue.
TEXT.German: Der Kaiser hat dich erwartet. Willkommen zureich.
TEXT.Italian: Il Cesare ti stava aspettando. Bentornato.
TEXT.Spanish: El Emperador os estaba esperando. Bienvenido.

TEXT.English: Burn them at the stake.
TEXT.French: De tels arguments incendiaires ne peuvent rester sans récompense !
TEXT.German: Besser ein kontrolliertes Lagerfeuer als ein Aufruhr.
TEXT.Italian: Dai qualcosa da fare al piromante di corte.
TEXT.Spanish: Úsalos como nuestra antorcha.

TEXT.English: Want to build a snowman?
TEXT.French: Mais alors, c'est juste moi, mais est-ce qui fait frisquet ? Oh, c'est juste eux ?
TEXT.German: Ich habe dafür keine Zeit. Schicken Sie sie in die Tundra.
TEXT.Italian: Mettili sul ghiaccio.
TEXT.Spanish: Dígales que "déjenlo ir". De todos modos, el frío nunca me molestó.

TEXT.English: Welcome to Hell, Peasant!
TEXT.French: Bienvenue en enfer, paysan !
TEXT.German: Willkommen in der Hölle, Bauer!
TEXT.Italian: Benvenuto all'inferno, contadino!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Bienvenido al infierno!

TEXT.English: Get back to work!
TEXT.French: Jusqu'à présent, je passais une bonne journée... Invoquez les maîtres d'ouvre.
TEXT.German: Verschwende meine Zeit, ja?
TEXT.Italian: Ah, volontari!
TEXT.Spanish: Que se ganen el sustento.

TEXT.English: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have somehow became tainted - possibly they were poisoned by one of our enemies. Water shortages are widespread.
TEXT.French: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have somehow became tainted - possibly they were poisoned by one of our enemies. Water shortages are widespread.
TEXT.German: Die Wasservorräte von %s2_city wurden irgendwie verunreinigt - möglicherweise wurden sie von einem unserer Feinde vergiftet. Es kommt zu allgemeiner Wassknappheit.
TEXT.Italian: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have somehow became tainted - possibly they were poisoned by one of our enemies. Water shortages are widespread.
TEXT.Spanish: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have somehow became tainted - possibly they were poisoned by one of our enemies. Water shortages are widespread.

TEXT.English: Have our Water adepts purify our water supplies.
TEXT.French: Have our Water adepts purify our water supplies.
TEXT.German: Lasst die Wasservorräte von Wasser-Adepten reinigen.
TEXT.Italian: Have our Water adepts purify our water supplies.
TEXT.Spanish: Have our Water adepts purify our water supplies.

TEXT.English: The powers of Aquae Sucellus will have already removed any and all poisons.
TEXT.French: The powers of Aquae Sucellus will have already removed any and all poisons.
TEXT.German: Die Mächte von 'Sucellus' Träne' sollten mittlerweile jedwedes Gift und alles davon neutralisiert haben.
TEXT.Italian: The powers of Aquae Sucellus will have already removed any and all poisons.
TEXT.Spanish: The powers of Aquae Sucellus will have already removed any and all poisons.

TEXT.English: Begin cleansing operations immediately, and ration our water supplies until done.
TEXT.French: Begin cleansing operations immediately, and ration our water supplies until done.
TEXT.German: Veranlasst umgehend Reinigungsarbeiten und rationiert bis zu deren Abschluss unsere Vorräte.
TEXT.Italian: Begin cleansing operations immediately, and ration our water supplies until done.
TEXT.Spanish: Begin cleansing operations immediately, and ration our water supplies until done.

TEXT.English: Begin rationing our water supplies until nature herself finally cleans them.
TEXT.French: Begin rationing our water supplies until nature herself finally cleans them.
TEXT.German: Veranlasst die Rationierung der Wasservorräte, bis sie durch den natürlichen Lauf der Dinge wieder verfügbar sind.
TEXT.Italian: Begin rationing our water supplies until nature herself finally cleans them.
TEXT.Spanish: Begin rationing our water supplies until nature herself finally cleans them.

TEXT.English: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have finally become pure again.
TEXT.French: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have finally become pure again.
TEXT.German: Die Wasservorräte in %s2_city sind mittlerweile wieder rein und unbedenklich.
TEXT.Italian: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have finally become pure again.
TEXT.Spanish: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have finally become pure again.

TEXT.English: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have finally become pure again.
TEXT.French: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have finally become pure again.
TEXT.German: Die Wasservorräte in %s2_city sind mittlerweile wieder rein und unbedenklich.
TEXT.Italian: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have finally become pure again.
TEXT.Spanish: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have finally become pure again.

TEXT.English: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have finally become pure again.
TEXT.French: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have finally become pure again.
TEXT.German: Die Wasservorräte in %s2_city sind mittlerweile wieder rein und unbedenklich.
TEXT.Italian: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have finally become pure again.
TEXT.Spanish: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have finally become pure again.

TEXT.English: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have finally become pure again.
TEXT.French: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have finally become pure again.
TEXT.German: Die Wasservorräte in %s2_city sind mittlerweile wieder rein und unbedenklich.
TEXT.Italian: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have finally become pure again.
TEXT.Spanish: The water supplies for our city of %s2_city have finally become pure again.

TEXT.English: This city (only) has a -2 health penalty for 5 turns.
TEXT.French: This city (only) has a -2 health penalty for 5 turns.
TEXT.German: Diese Stadt (nur diese) hat einen Gesundheitsmalus von -2 für 5 Runden.
TEXT.Italian: This city (only) has a -2 health penalty for 5 turns.
TEXT.Spanish: This city (only) has a -2 health penalty for 5 turns.

TEXT.English: This city (only) has a -3 health penalty and -1 anger for 10 turns.
TEXT.French: This city (only) has a -3 health penalty and -1 anger for 10 turns.
TEXT.German: Diese Stadt (nur diese) erleidet einen Abzug von -3 auf Gesundheit und -1 Zufriedenheit für 10 Runden.
TEXT.Italian: This city (only) has a -3 health penalty and -1 anger for 10 turns.
TEXT.Spanish: This city (only) has a -3 health penalty and -1 anger for 10 turns.

TEXT.English: The %s1_civ_adjective Empire has had a scandal break out that somehow it looks like our diplomats there were involved in. Our relations with them will suffer unless we can prove we're innocent. We are, right?
TEXT.French: The %s1_civ_adjective Empire has had a scandal break out that somehow it looks like our diplomats there were involved in. Our relations with them will suffer unless we can prove we're innocent. We are, right?
TEXT.German: Das %s1_civ_adjective Reich gab es einen großen Skandal, und irgendwie wirkt es so, als wären unsere Diplomaten involviert. Unsere Beziehungen zu diesem Volk werden leiden, wenn wir nicht unsere Unschuld beweisen können. Wir sind doch unschuldig, oder?
TEXT.Italian: The %s1_civ_adjective Empire has had a scandal break out that somehow it looks like our diplomats there were involved in. Our relations with them will suffer unless we can prove we're innocent. We are, right?
TEXT.Spanish: The %s1_civ_adjective Empire has had a scandal break out that somehow it looks like our diplomats there were involved in. Our relations with them will suffer unless we can prove we're innocent. We are, right?

TEXT.English: Our Mind adepts will prove we are innocent.
TEXT.French: Our Mind adepts will prove we are innocent.
TEXT.German: Unsere Geist-Adepten werden unsere Unschuld beweisen.
TEXT.Italian: Our Mind adepts will prove we are innocent.
TEXT.Spanish: Our Mind adepts will prove we are innocent.

TEXT.English: We shall prove another civilization caused this.
TEXT.French: We shall prove another civilization caused this.
TEXT.German: Wir werden beweisen, dass es ein anderes Volk war.
TEXT.Italian: We shall prove another civilization caused this.
TEXT.Spanish: We shall prove another civilization caused this.

TEXT.English: We are innocent, but have no proof.
TEXT.French: We are innocent, but have no proof.
TEXT.German: Wir sind unschuldig, haben aber keinen Beweis.
TEXT.Italian: We are innocent, but have no proof.
TEXT.Spanish: We are innocent, but have no proof.

TEXT.English: Yes, we're innocent. But tell them we did it - and that they deserved it.
TEXT.French: Yes, we're innocent. But tell them we did it - and that they deserved it.
TEXT.German: Ja, wir sind unschuldig. Doch sagt ihnen ruhig, wir wären es gewesen - und dass sie es verdient hätten.
TEXT.Italian: Yes, we're innocent. But tell them we did it - and that they deserved it.
TEXT.Spanish: Yes, we're innocent. But tell them we did it - and that they deserved it.

TEXT.English: The %s1_civ_adjective ambassador has been implicated in a scandal involving important people in our government. This has adversely affected our relations with their country.
TEXT.French: The %s1_civ_adjective ambassador has been implicated in a scandal involving important people in our government. This has adversely affected our relations with their country.
TEXT.German: Der %s1_civ_adjective Botschafter wurde mit einem Skandal in Verbindung gebracht, in den wichtige Personen unserer verwickelt sind. Das hat unsere Beziehungen zu diesem Reich nachteilig beeinflusst.
TEXT.Italian: The %s1_civ_adjective ambassador has been implicated in a scandal involving important people in our government. This has adversely affected our relations with their country.
TEXT.Spanish: The %s1_civ_adjective ambassador has been implicated in a scandal involving important people in our government. This has adversely affected our relations with their country.

TEXT.English: A group of cultists in an Ancient Tower have summoned a Demon from Hell. Fortunately a band of adventurers killed the cultists and trapped the demon in the Tower.
TEXT.French: A group of cultists in an Ancient Tower have summoned a Demon from Hell. Fortunately a band of adventurers killed the cultists and trapped the demon in the Tower.
TEXT.German: Eine Kultistengruppe hat in einem Alten Turm einen Dämonen aus der Hölle beschworen. Glücklicherweise hat eine Gruppe von Abenteurern diese Kultisten getötet und den Dämon im Turm eingesperrt.
